revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with '{{Infobox officeholder |name = Shifa Mohamed |image = |alt = |caption = Shifa in 2019 |order = |office = [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] |President = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] |predecessor = Dr Musthafa Luthfee |successor = [[Asim Ahmed]] |term_start = 11 December 2010 |term_end = 7 February 2012 |office2...'
revision.text: {{Infobox officeholder |name = Shifa Mohamed |image = |alt = |caption = Shifa in 2019 |order = |office = [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] |President = [[Mohamed Nasheed]] |predecessor = Dr Musthafa Luthfee |successor = [[Asim Ahmed]] |term_start = 11 December 2010 |term_end = 7 February 2012 |office2 = Mayor of [[Malé]] |predecessor2 = Ali Maniku<ref>{{cite web |title=President meets Male’ City Mayor |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/6760 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=09 February 2012}}</ref> |successor2 = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] |termstart2 = June 4, 2017 |termend2 = 17 May 2021 |birth_date = |birth_place = [[Malé]] |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |restingplacecoordinates = |birthname = |nationality = [[Maldives]] |party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] |spouse = }} '''Shifa Mohamed''' was the former [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] of the [[Maldives]] under president [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s goverment and later served as the Mayor of [[Malé]] untill 2019 she was elected as the Mayor of June 4, 2017 <ref>{{cite news |last1=Online |first1=Avas |title=Shifa elected as Male City Mayor |url=https://avas.mv/en/34485 |access-date=June 4, 2017}}</ref> She also served as the [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Deputy Minister of Education]].<ref>{{cite web |title=President Appoints New Home Minister and Education Minister |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/1691 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=11 December 2010}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Mayors of places in the Maldives]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian politicians]]

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Shifa Mohamed |image = |alt = |caption = Shifa in 2019 |order = |office = [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] |predecessor = Dr Musthafa Luthfee |successor = [[Asim Ahmed]] |term_start = 11 December 2010 |term_end = 7 February 2012 |office2 = Mayor of [[Malé]] |predecessor2 = Ali Maniku<ref>{{cite web |title=President meets Male’ City Mayor |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/6760 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=9 February 2012}}</ref> |successor2 = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] |termstart2 = June 4, 2017 |termend2 = 17 May 2021 |birth_date = |birth_place = [[Malé]] |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |restingplacecoordinates = |birthname = |nationality = [[Maldives]] |party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] |spouse = }} '''Shifa Mohamed''' was the former [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] of the [[Maldives]] under president [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s goverment and later served as the Mayor of [[Malé]] untill 2019 she was elected as the Mayor of June 4, 2017 <ref>{{cite news |last1=Online |first1=Avas |title=Shifa elected as Male City Mayor |url=https://avas.mv/en/34485 |access-date=June 4, 2017}}</ref> She also served as the [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Deputy Minister of Education]].<ref>{{cite web |title=President Appoints New Home Minister and Education Minister |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/1691 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=11 December 2010}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Mayors of places in the Maldives]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian politicians]]

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Shifa Mohamed |image = Shifa Mohamed.jpg |alt = |caption = Shifa in 2019 |order = |office = [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] |predecessor = Dr Musthafa Luthfee |successor = [[Asim Ahmed]] |term_start = 11 December 2010 |term_end = 7 February 2012 |office2 = Mayor of [[Malé]] |predecessor2 = Ali Maniku<ref>{{cite web |title=President meets Male’ City Mayor |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/6760 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=9 February 2012}}</ref> |successor2 = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] |termstart2 = June 4, 2017 |termend2 = 17 May 2021 |birth_date = |birth_place = [[Malé]] |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |restingplacecoordinates = |birthname = |nationality = [[Maldives]] |party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] |spouse = }} '''Shifa Mohamed''' was the former [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] of the [[Maldives]] under president [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s goverment and later served as the Mayor of [[Malé]] untill 2019 she was elected as the Mayor of June 4, 2017 <ref>{{cite news |last1=Online |first1=Avas |title=Shifa elected as Male City Mayor |url=https://avas.mv/en/34485 |access-date=June 4, 2017}}</ref> She also served as the [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Deputy Minister of Education]].<ref>{{cite web |title=President Appoints New Home Minister and Education Minister |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/1691 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=11 December 2010}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Mayors of places in the Maldives]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian politicians]]

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Shifa Mohamed |image = Shifa Mohamed.jpg |alt = |caption = Shifa in 2019 |order = |office = [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] |predecessor = Dr Musthafa Luthfee |successor = [[Asim Ahmed]] |term_start = 11 December 2010 |term_end = 7 February 2012 |office2 = Mayor of [[Malé]] |predecessor2 = Ali Maniku<ref>{{cite web |title=President meets Male’ City Mayor |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/6760 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=9 February 2012}}</ref> |successor2 = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] |termstart2 = June 4, 2017 |termend2 = 17 May 2021 |birth_date = |birth_place = [[Malé]] |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |restingplacecoordinates = |birthname = |nationality = [[Maldives]] |party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] |spouse = }} '''Shifa Mohamed''' was the former [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] of the [[Maldives]] under president [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s govermment and later served as the Mayor of [[Malé]] untill 2019 she was elected as the Mayor of June 4, 2017 <ref>{{cite news |last1=Online |first1=Avas |title=Shifa elected as Male City Mayor |url=https://avas.mv/en/34485 |access-date=June 4, 2017}}</ref> She also served as the [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Deputy Minister of Education]].<ref>{{cite web |title=President Appoints New Home Minister and Education Minister |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/1691 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=11 December 2010}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Mayors of places in the Maldives]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian politicians]]

{{Infobox officeholder |name = Shifa Mohamed |image = Shifa Mohamed.jpg |alt = |caption = Shifa in 2019 |order = |office = [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] |predecessor = Dr Musthafa Luthfee |successor = [[Asim Ahmed]] |term_start = 11 December 2010 |term_end = 7 February 2012 |office2 = Mayor of [[Malé]] |predecessor2 = Ali Maniku<ref>{{cite web |title=President meets Male’ City Mayor |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/6760 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=9 February 2012}}</ref> |successor2 = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] |termstart2 = June 4, 2017 |termend2 = 17 May 2021 |birth_date = |birth_place = [[Malé]] |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |restingplacecoordinates = |birthname = |nationality = [[Maldives]] |party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] |spouse = }} '''Shifa Mohamed''' was the former [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] of the [[Maldives]] under president [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s government and later served as the Mayor of [[Malé]] untill 2019 she was elected as the Mayor of June 4, 2017 <ref>{{cite news |last1=Online |first1=Avas |title=Shifa elected as Male City Mayor |url=https://avas.mv/en/34485 |access-date=June 4, 2017}}</ref> She also served as the [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Deputy Minister of Education]].<ref>{{cite web |title=President Appoints New Home Minister and Education Minister |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/1691 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=11 December 2010}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Mayors of places in the Maldives]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian politicians]]

{{Short description|Maldivian politician}} {{Infobox officeholder |name = Shifa Mohamed |image = Shifa Mohamed.jpg |alt = |caption = Shifa in 2019 |order = |office = [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] |predecessor = Dr Musthafa Luthfee |successor = [[Asim Ahmed]] |term_start = 11 December 2010 |term_end = 7 February 2012 |office2 = Mayor of [[Malé]] |predecessor2 = Ali Maniku<ref>{{cite web |title=President meets Male’ City Mayor |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/6760 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=9 February 2012}}</ref> |successor2 = [[Mohamed Muizzu]] |termstart2 = June 4, 2017 |termend2 = 17 May 2021 |birth_date = |birth_place = [[Malé]] |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |restingplacecoordinates = |birthname = |nationality = [[Maldives]] |party = [[Maldivian Democratic Party]] |spouse = }} '''Shifa Mohamed''' was the former [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Minister of Education]] of the [[Maldives]] under president [[Mohamed Nasheed]]'s government and later served as the Mayor of [[Malé]] untill 2019 she was elected as the Mayor of June 4, 2017 <ref>{{cite news |last1=Online |first1=Avas |title=Shifa elected as Male City Mayor |url=https://avas.mv/en/34485 |access-date=June 4, 2017}}</ref> She also served as the [[Ministry of Education (Maldives)|Deputy Minister of Education]].<ref>{{cite web |title=President Appoints New Home Minister and Education Minister |url=https://presidency.gov.mv/Press/Article/1691 |website=The Presidents Office, Maldives |access-date=11 December 2010}}</ref> ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Malé]] [[Category:Maldivian politicians]] [[Category:Mayors of places in the Maldives]] [[Category:21st-century Maldivian politicians]]
